alert.note: Alert for Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 9:46PM CDT until May 27 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska...Kansas... Driftwood Creek Near McCook 4sw affecting Red Willow County. Republican River At Mccook 1se affecting Red Willow County. Frenchman Creek Near Culbertson affecting Hitchcock County. Beaver Creek At Cedar Bluffs affecting Decatur and Red Willow Counties. .Flooding continues to be a threat for much of Southwest Nebraska and far Northwest Kansas. Another round of rainfall is approaching the warning area from the west. If additional heavy rainfall occurs, that may lead to another minor rise in river stages late tonight or some time Saturday, especially in Southwest Nebraska. For the Frenchman Creek...including Culbertson...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Driftwood Creek Near McCook 4sw. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Lowland areas will become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM CDT Friday the stage was 18.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 PM CDT Friday was 22.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 3.2 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.5 feet on 04/24/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 945 AM CDT.
